value: Evening Prayer

value.label: Confession
value: Let us confess our sins to God.
Silence may be kept.
Minister and People

God of all mercy,
we confess that we have sinned against you,
opposing your will in our lives.
We have denied your goodness in each other,
in ourselves, and in the world you have created.
We repent of the evil that enslaves us,
    the evil we have done,
and the evil done on our behalf.
Forgive, restore, and strengthen us
through our Savior Jesus Christ,
that we may abide in your love
and serve only your will.
Almighty God have mercy on us, forgive us all our sins through the grace of Jesus Christ, strengthen us in all goodness, and by the power of the Holy Spirit keep us in eternal life.
Almighty God have mercy on you, forgive you all your sins through the grace of Jesus Christ, strengthen you in all goodness, and by the power of the Holy Spirit keep you in eternal life.
Invitatory and Psalter
All stand

value.text: O God, be not far from us.
value.label: Officiant
People
value.text: Come quickly to help us, O God.

value: Alleluia.

value.verse:
Light of the world, in grace and beauty,
Mirror of God’s eternal face,
Transparent flame of love’s free duty,
You bring salvation to our race.
Now, as we see the lights of evening,
We raise our voice in hymns of praise;
Worthy are you of endless blessing,
Sun of our night, lamp of our days.

O gracious Light, Lord Jesus Christ,
in you the Father's glory shone.
Immortal, holy, blest is he,
and blest are you, his holy Son.

Now sunset comes, but light shines forth,
the lamps are lit to pierce the night.
Praise Father, Son, and Spirit: God
who dwells in the eternal light.

Worthy are you of endless praise,
O Son of God, Life-giving Lord;
wherefore you are through all the earth
and in the highest heaven adored.

value: Yours is the day, O God, yours also the night; you established the moon and the sun.

value.verse: Behold now, bless the LORD, all you servants of the LORD, *
value.halfverse: you that stand by night in the house of the LORD.

value.verse: Lift up your hands in the holy place and bless the LORD; *
value.halfverse: the LORD who made heaven and earth bless you out of Zion.

value.verse: O LORD, I call to you; come to me quickly; *
value.halfverse: hear my voice when I cry to you.

value.verse: Let my prayer be set forth in your sight as incense, *
value.halfverse: the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

value.verse:
Set a watch before my mouth, O LORD,
and guard the door of my lips; *
value.halfverse: let not my heart incline to any evil thing.

value.verse: Let me not be occupied in wickedness with evildoers, *

value.halfverse: for my prayer is continually against their wicked deeds.
value.verse:
Let the righteous smite me in friendly rebuke;
let not the oil of the unrighteous anoint my head; *

value.halfverse: that they may know my words are true.
value.verse: Let their rulers be overthrown in stony places, *

value.halfverse: let their bones be scattered at the mouth of the grave.
value.verse: As when a plowman turns over the earth in furrows, *

value.halfverse:
in you I take refuge;
 do not strip me of my life.
value.verse: But my eyes are turned to you, Lord GOD; *

value.halfverse: and from the traps of the evildoers.
value.verse: Protect me from the snare which they have laid for me *
Let the wicked fall into their own nets, *

value: Let my prayer be set forth in your sight as incense, the lifting up of my hands as the  evening sacrifice.
The Lessons
A Reading from ${longName}.

value.text: Hear what the Spirit is saying to God’s people.

value: A Reading from ${longName}.

value.text: Hear what the Spirit is saying to God’s people.

value: A Reading from ${longName}.

value.text: Hear what the Spirit is saying to God’s people.

value: The Sermon

value.label: The Apostles’ Creed
value:
I believe in God, the Father almighty,
	creator of heaven and earth.
I believe in Jesus Christ, God’s only Son, our Lord,
	who was conceived by the Holy Spirit
	born of the Virgin Mary,
	suffered under Pontius Pilate,
	was crucified, died, and was buried; 
	he descended to the dead.
	On the third day he rose again;
	he ascended into heaven,
	he is seated at the right hand of the Father,
	and he will come again to judge the living and the dead.
I believe in the Holy Spirit,
	the holy catholic Church,
	the communion of saints,
	the forgiveness of sins,
	the resurrection of the body,
	and the life everlasting.
The Prayers

value.label: Officiant
value.text: Hear our cry, O God.

value.label: People
value.text: And listen to our prayer.

value.label: Officiant
value.text: Let us pray.

value:
Our Father, who art in heaven,
	hallowed be thy Name,
	thy kingdom come,
	thy will be done,
	on earth as it is in heaven.
Give us this day our daily bread.
And forgive us our trespasses,
	as we forgive those
	who trespass against us.
And lead us not into temptation,
	but deliver us from evil.
For thine is the kingdom,
	and the power, and the glory,
	for ever and ever.
value.label: The Lord’s Prayer
The Lord’s Prayer
value:
Our Father in heaven,
	hallowed be your Name,
	your kingdom come,
	your will be done,
	on earth as in heaven.
Give us today our daily bread.
Forgive us our sins,
	as we forgive those
	who sin against us.
Save us from the time of trial,
	and deliver us from evil.
For the kingdom, the power,
	and the glory are yours,
	now and for ever.

value.label: V.
value.text: Show us your mercy, O Lord;
And grant us your salvation.
value.label: R.
V.
value.text: Clothe your ministers with righteousness;

value.label: R.
value.text: Let your people sing with joy.

value.label: V.
value.text: Give peace, O Lord, in all the world;

value.label: R.
value.text: For only in you can we live in safety.
Lord, keep this nation under your care;
value.label: V.

value.text: And guide us in the way of justice and truth.
value.label: R.

value.text: Let your way be known upon earth;
value.label: V.
R.
value.text: Your saving health among all nations.
Let not the needy, O Lord, be forgotten;
value.label: V.

value.text: Nor the hope of the poor be taken away.
value.label: R.
V.
value.text: Create in us clean hearts, O God;

value.label: R.
value.text: And sustain us with your Holy Spirit.
That this evening may be holy, good, and peaceful.
That your holy angels may lead us in paths of peace and goodwill,
That we may be pardoned and forgiven for our sins and offenses,
That there may be peace to your Church and to the whole world,
That we may depart this life in your faith and fear, and not be condemned before the great judgment seat of Christ,
That we may be bound together by your Holy Spirit in the communion of [________ and] all your saints, entrusting one another and all our life to Christ,

value.label: A Collect for Fridays
value: Lord Jesus Christ, by your death you took away the sting of death: Grant to us your servants so to follow in faith where you have led the way, that we may at length fall asleep peacefully in you and wake up in your likeness; for your tender mercies’ sake.

value.label: A Collect for Saturdays
value: O God, the source of eternal light: Shed forth your unending day upon us who watch for you, that our lips may praise you, our lives may bless you, and our worship on the morrow give you glory; through Jesus Christ our Lord.

value.label: A Collect for Sundays
value: Lord God, whose Son our Savior Jesus Christ triumphed over the powers of death and prepared for us our place in the new Jerusalem: Grant that we, who have this day given thanks for his resurrection, may praise you in that City of which he is the light, and where he lives and reigns for ever and ever.
The Sermon
Here may be sung a hymn or anthem.
Authorized intercessions and thanksgivings may follow.
Before the close of the Office one or both of the following may be used

value.label: The General Thanksgiving
value:
Almighty God, Father of all mercies,
we your unworthy servants give you humble thanks
for all your goodness and loving-kindness
to us and to all whom you have made.
We bless you for our creation, preservation,
and all the blessings of this life;
but above all for your immeasurable love
in the redemption of the world by our Lord Jesus Christ;
for the means of grace, and for the hope of glory.

And, we pray, give us such an awareness of your mercies,
that with truly thankful hearts we may show forth your praise,
not only with our lips, but in our lives,
by giving up our selves to your service,
and by walking before you
in holiness and righteousness all our days;
through Jesus Christ our Lord,
to whom, with you and the Holy Spirit,
be honor and glory throughout all ages.

value.label: A Prayer of St. Chrysostom
value: Almighty God, you have given us grace at this time with one accord to make our common supplication to you; and you have promised through your well-beloved Son that when two or three are gathered together in his Name you will be in the midst of them: Fulfill now, O Lord, our desires and petitions as may be best for us; granting us in this world knowledge of your truth, and in the age to come life everlasting.
Then may be said

value.text: Let us bless the Lord.

value.response: Thanks be to God. Alleluia, alleluia.
value.text: Let us bless the Lord. Alleluia, alleluia.

value: The Officiant may then conclude with one of the following
